🎮【Support Play on TV】There is a AV output cable and USB cable so that you can connect connect the 3.0-inch screen game consoles to the TV so that you can enjoy the fascinating and lively video game in bigger screen. allowing you to enjoy lively and fun video games.

🎮【1020mAh Rechargeable battery】Built-in 1020mAh large-capacity lithium battery, the game can provide up to 6-8 hours of gaming time on a single charge, perfect for playing travel or on the go, so you can enjoy playing it anywhere at any time.

🎮【Portable Handheld Game Console】Compact size (3.5*4.5*0.8in) and (0.27lb) Lightweight, Small size makes it portable to be in your pocket, handbag. take with you in your pocket, bag. Keep you entertained in travel, work, camp, or other outdoor activities.

🎮【Perfect Gift for Kids & Adult】Our handheld game console is ideal for Birthday, Christmas, Wedding Anniversary, Thanksgiving, New Year and Holidays gifts for kids, boys, girls, adults, family and friends. The interactive entertainment of game competition enhances interaction, bringing more happiness to the whole family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for a time waster with my 6yo and easy to use

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For those scrolling: This is an okay little video game player. Lots of knockoff games, a little wonky with the clock speed, and few big titles you know. Perfectly okay.I like video games just fine. Also, I like retro games just fine (had an NES and SNES growing up). Also, I am a fully grown adult :)There are maybe ten to twenty titles on this you'll want to play (and a lot of others you'll look into out of curiosity). The ones you're looking for are generally solid enough emulations (albeit the Japanese versions, which is fine for most stuff). I'm not naming names because I suspect that is a way to get the review flagged, but the ones you are wondering about, the ones from that game system in the late 1980s you used to play with rented games from Blockbuster? Yeah, there are likely on here. Nothing too much later than 1991 or so though. Note: The knockoffs are here and they are sometimes funny, sometimes briefly entertaining, sometimes a remask of other IPs, but always worth less than five minutes of play.There are some pretty noticeable game speed issues, likely due to uncalibrated clock speeds (the rate which the game should run against the hardware), usually leading to games running 25-50% faster than they should. This is fine for most people who are just looking for a novelty to kill time, but if you are a person who has a lot of experience with any of these games you'll find it a kinda difficult to readjust.The size is good, a little smaller than the original gameboy. The battery is ample. The color is fun. The screen works pretty well. The buttons are not super clicky nor are they overly mushy, and fairly responsive.So, if you want a retro devise you can treat as more or less disposable for a trip or to entertain children or anything like that, this will absolutely work for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars You Get What You Pay For
reviews.reviewText: It’s ok. Feels and sounds cheap but it works. As many others have said, many of the games are clones of each other. What I wasn’t aware of/haven’t figured out yet is whether I can save my in game progress or not. There doesn’t appear to be a way to save and/or go back to the main screen without losing your progress. It’s cool for the nostalgia of that’s what you’re looking for

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars the worst game console- do not waste your money on this JUNK
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT BUY THIS HANDHELD GAME CONSOLE WITH 500 GAMES - YEAH RIGHT A joke! it broke after my children played with it 4 times and they are so sweet and gentle. I AM SO MAD.. ITS JUNK DO NOT WASTE YOUR $$$$$$ SO UPSET ABOUT IT I MISSED INTERPRET WORDS, PLEASE DO NOT LET YOUR CHILDREN DOWN AND THIS WAS A SIBLING GIFT FOR THE BOTH OF THEM AND IT FAILED !So disappointing when you review the reviews and think this might last at least 6 months but not after 4 uses!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: So first thing worth mentioning. You do not actually get 500 games with this. Many of the games were duplicated, and many of the games were "reskinned". So for example, there is one they labelled as Super Mario 6, but it is actually just Tiny Toon Adventures with Mario (the one from Super Mario 3) in place of Buster Bunny....There are also numerous repeats, too many to even count. But what I mean by this is that many games are in the list multiple times.Now, that being said, there are still a lot of really cool, old games, on this device, and it definitely worth ordering.Some of the best games, IMO...The Original NES Super MarioSuper Mario Bros. 3Pac-ManTiny Toon AdventuresContraDonkey Kongand many more...Those were just the ones I can remember as I write this.The device worked flawlessly when connected to a TV that was compatible with the VGA cables it uses. The controller also worked great and playing with two players was perfect.The device itself does feel a bit cheaply made. But If you take care of it, it will certainly provide hours of playtime. I have spent quite a few hours since I got this playing through all of Super Mario Bros. 3.I highly recommend this game device, especially for how much it cost.Giving 4 stars because the Dpad on the device can be a little finicky, and can register the wrong directions if you arent precise with how you are pressing on the Dpad. And Also for the fact that there actually is not 500 games. There are 500 labels, but not 500 different games.I kind of expected some shenanigans like that, so I am not disappointed, and in my opinion, there is still plenty of unique classic games included to justify the value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun and nostalgic!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my husband. It's really fun! It reminds him of GameBoy days growing up. The games are kind of repetitive, but still fun.
